item.title: Capcom announces Capcom Games Competition – student competition utilizing RE ENGINE
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/capcom-announces-capcom-games-competition-student-competition-utilizing-re-engine

Applications open until January 17, 2025.

Capcom has announced Capcom Games Competition, its first-ever game competition for students in Japan utilizing its proprietary RE ENGINE.

The competition will see students create games utilizing development tools such as RE ENGINE in a cloud environment. Students will form teams of up to 20 people, in which they will assign roles according to game creator job types, receive support from professional Capcom developers, and work toward creating one game in a half-year period. Capcom also plans to offer game production support with an opportunity for commercialization to award winners. Each respective team will retain ownership and copyright of their games.

Capcom said its goal in holding this competition is to strengthen the videogame industry and serve as a responsible corporate citizen, and that it will continue to conduct corporate social responsibility activities going forward.

Applications for the competition will be available from December 9, 2024 to January 17, 2025. Students who are at least 18 years old and enrolled in a university, graduate school, or vocational school in Japan are eligible to apply. The application form is available here.

item.title: Utakata no Uchronia fan disc Utakata no Uchronia: trail announced for Switch
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/utakata-no-uchronia-fan-disc-utakata-no-uchronia-trail-announced-for-switch

  • Switch

Due out in 2025 in Japan.

Publisher Broccoli and developer LicoBiTs have announced otome visual novel Utakata no Uchronia fan disc Utakata no Uchronia: trail for Switch. It will launch in 2025 in Japan.

The game’s cast and staff include:

  • Cast
    • Yashiro (voiced by Chiaki Kobayashi)
    • Tobari (voiced by Nobuhiko Okamoto)
    • Awayuki (voiced by Soma Saito)
    • Yori (voiced by Takuya Eguchi)
    • Tsuyukusa (voiced by Yoshitsugu Matsuoka)
    • Hiiragi (voiced by Toshiyuki Toyonaga)
    • Tsuwabuki (voiced by Yōhei Azakami)
    • …and more!
  • Staff
    • Director: Asahi Takamura
    • Character Design and Illustrations: RiRi
    • Main Scenario: Kazura Ringo
    • Background Music: MANYO
    • Chibi Character Illustrations: Uta

Watch the teaser trailer below.

Announce Teaser Trailer
